revised_title: Molecular Orbital Perturbation Theory: Charge Displacement and Stabilization in Conjugated Molecules
tldr: The authors develop a self-consistent molecular orbital theory for conjugated molecules using molecular orbital perturbation theory. They study inductive and electromeric displacements in conjugated molecules, providing insights into energy stabilization and charge distribution changes. The theory is applied to inductive substituents in benzene and electromeric displacements in furan, pyrrole, aniline, and phenol.
